and the other of the 
four stars which form 
the <u>Trapezium <\u> in the 
Nebula of Orion, on the 
2nd February last.
The photographs were 
taken with my 20 inch 
silver-on-glass reflector,
and the exposures made 
successively on the same 
plate, beginning with <u>one 
second <\u> of time and pro-
gressively doubling it up 
to 64 minutes. There are 
thus in the case of <u>Polaris <\u>
thirteen images obtained 
under conditions so nearly 
alike as regards sensit-
